docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: heading - Content will be placed at the top of the horizontal card to the right of the icon.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: message - Content will be placed in the main body of the horizontal card.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: image - Content will be placed to the left of all other content.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: icon - Content will be placed to the left of the horizontal card heading.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: badge - Badge component overlaying the top right of the horizontal card.

props.name: clickable
props.docs: If `true`, the horizontal card will be a clickable variant, instead of static.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the horizontal card will be disabled if it is clickable.

props.name: heading
props.docs: The heading for the horizontal card. This is required, unless a slotted heading is used.

props.name: href
props.docs: The URL that the clickable horizontal card link points to. If set, the clickable horizontal card will render as an "a" tag, otherwise it will render as a button.

props.name: hreflang
props.docs: The human language of the linked URL.

props.name: message
props.docs: The main body message of the horizontal card.

props.name: referrerpolicy
props.docs: How much of the referrer to send when following the link.

props.name: rel
props.docs: The relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the horizontal card.

props.name: target
props.docs: The place to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context (a tab, window, or iframe).

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the theme color to the dark or light theme color. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

slots.name: badge
slots.docs: Badge component overlaying the top right of the horizontal card.

slots.name: heading
slots.docs: Content will be placed at the top of the horizontal card to the right of the icon.

slots.name: icon
slots.docs: Content will be placed to the left of the horizontal card heading.

slots.name: image
slots.docs: Content will be placed to the left of all other content.

slots.name: message
slots.docs: Content will be placed in the main body of the horizontal card.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: empty-state - Content is slotted below the table header when there is no data and the table is not loading.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: {COLUMN_KEY}-{ROW_INDEX}[-icon] - Each cell should have its own slot, named using the column tag and the row index, allowing for custom elements to be displayed. Include `-icon` at the end for that cell's icon slot.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: {COLUMN_KEY}-column-icon - The icon slot for a column header.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: title-bar - A custom ic-data-table-title-bar can be slotted above the column headers to display additional information about the table.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: pagination-bar - A custom ic-pagination-bar can be slotted below the data to provide enhanced control over how the data is interacted with when being fetched externally.

props.name: caption
props.docs: The title for the table only visible to screen readers.

props.name: columnHeaderTruncation
props.docs: Determines whether the column header should be truncated and display a tooltip. Default is `false`.

props.name: columns
props.docs: The column headers for the table.

props.name: data
props.docs: The row content for the table.

props.name: density
props.docs: Set the density of the table including font and padding.

props.name: disableAutoSort
props.docs: If `true`, the built in sort functionality will be disabled. For example, if rows will already be sorted from an external source.

props.name: embedded
props.docs: Applies a border to the table container.

props.name: globalRowHeight
props.docs: Sets the row height on all rows in the table that aren't set using the `variableRowHeight` method.

props.name: height
props.docs: Sets the table height. Can be set to `auto` or a specific value in `px`, `rem`, or `%`.

props.name: hideColumnHeaders
props.docs: If `true`, column headers will not be visible.

props.name: loading
props.docs: When set to `true`, the full table will show a loading state, featuring a radial indicator.

props.name: loadingOptions
props.type: undefined | { description?: string | undefined; label?: string | undefined; labelDuration?: number | undefined; max?: number | undefined; min?: number | undefined; progress?: number | undefined; monochrome?: boolean | undefined; overlay?: boolean | undefined; }

complexType.resolved: undefined | { description?: string | undefined; label?: string | undefined; labelDuration?: number | undefined; max?: number | undefined; min?: number | undefined; progress?: number | undefined; monochrome?: boolean | undefined; overlay?: boolean | undefined; }

props.docs: Sets the props for the circular loading indicator used in the loading state.

props.name: maxWidth
props.docs: Sets the maximum width of the data table. Can be set in `px`, `rem`, or `%`.

props.name: minWidth
props.docs: Sets the minimum width of the data table. Can be set in `px`, `rem`, or `%`.

props.name: minimumLoadingDisplayDuration
props.docs: The minimum amount of time the `loading` state displays for before showing the data. Used to prevent flashing in the component.

props.name: paginationBarOptions
props.docs: Sets the props for the built-in pagination bar. If the `pagination-bar` slot is used then this prop is ignored.
props.default:
{
    alignment: "right",
    hideAllFromItemsPerPage: false,
    hideRangeLabel: false,
    itemLabel: "Item",
    itemsPerPageOptions: [
      { label: "10", value: "10" },
      { label: "25", value: "25" },
      { label: "50", value: "50" },
    ],
    monochrome: false,
    pageLabel: "Page",
    rangeLabelType: "page",
    selectedItemsPerPage: 10,
    setToFirstPageOnPaginationChange: false,
    showGoToPageControl: true,
    showItemsPerPageControl: true,
    type: "simple",
  }

props.name: rowSelection
props.docs: If `true`, a checkbox column will be displayed to the left of the table which allows multiple rows to be selected.

props.name: showPagination
props.docs: If `true`, adds a pagination bar to the bottom of the table.

props.name: sortOptions
props.docs: Sets the order columns will be sorted in and allows for 'default' sorts to be added.

props.name: sortable
props.docs: If `true`, allows table columns to be sorted using applied sort buttons.

props.name: stickyColumnHeaders
props.docs: If `true`, column headers will remain at the top of the table when scrolling vertically.

props.name: stickyRowHeaders
props.docs: If `true`, row headers will remain to the left when scrolling horizontally.

props.name: tableLayout
props.docs: Sets the layout of the table

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the theme color to the dark or light theme color. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

props.name: truncationPattern
props.docs: Sets the method used to truncate long text in cells where textWrap is `false`. The `tooltip` truncation pattern allows the overflowing text to be seen in a tooltip. The `show-hide` truncation pattern allows the overflowing text to be shown and hidden using the ic-typography "See more"/"See less" buttons.

props.name: updating
props.docs: If `true`, the table displays a linear loading indicator below the header row to indicate an updating state.

props.name: updatingOptions
props.type: undefined | { description?: string | undefined; max?: number | undefined; min?: number | undefined; progress?: number | undefined; monochrome?: boolean | undefined; }

complexType.resolved: undefined | { description?: string | undefined; max?: number | undefined; min?: number | undefined; progress?: number | undefined; monochrome?: boolean | undefined; }

props.docs: Sets the props for the linear loading indicator used in the updating state.

props.name: variableRowHeight
props.type: ((params: { [key: string]: any; index: number; }) => IcDataTableRowHeights | null) | undefined

complexType.resolved: ((params: { [key: string]: any; index: number; }) => IcDataTableRowHeights | null) | undefined

props.docs:
Allows for custom setting of row heights on individual rows based on an individual value from the `data` prop and the row index.
If the function returns `null`, that row's height will be set to the `globalRowHeight` property.

props.name: width
props.docs: Sets the table width. Can be set to `auto` or a specific value in `px`, `rem`, or `%`.

methods.name: resetRowHeights
methods.docs: Resets the `globalRowHeight` prop to number or auto and sets the `variableRowHeight` prop to `null`.

events.docs: Emitted when the `globalRowHeight` or `variableRowHeight` properties change in the data table.
Emitted when all rows are selected or deselected in the data table via the "select all" checkbox.
Emitted when the selected row changes in the data table.
Emitted when a column sort button is clicked.

slots.name: empty-state
slots.docs: Content is slotted below the table header when there is no data and the table is not loading.

slots.name: pagination-bar
slots.docs: A custom ic-pagination-bar can be slotted below the data to provide enhanced control over how the data is interacted with when being fetched externally.

slots.name: title-bar
slots.docs: A custom ic-data-table-title-bar can be slotted above the column headers to display additional information about the table.

slots.name: {COLUMN_KEY}-column-icon
slots.docs: The icon slot for a column header.

slots.name: {COLUMN_KEY}-{ROW_INDEX}[-icon]
slots.docs: Each cell should have its own slot, named using the column tag and the row index, allowing for custom elements to be displayed. Include `-icon` at the end for that cell's icon slot.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: primary-action - Render an interactive element that will perform a primary action. Renders to the right of the density select.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: custom-actions - Render additional custom actions to the left of the density select.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: heading - The heading to render on the data table title bar.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: description - Render an alternative description in the description section.

props.name: description
props.docs: The description that is displayed below the `heading` and `metadata`. Can be overridden with the `description` slot.

props.name: heading
props.docs: The heading of the title bar. Can be overridden with the `heading` slot. If used with an `ic-data-table` it will default to the table's `caption` unless overridden.

props.name: hideDensitySelect
props.docs: When `true`, the density select will not be rendered.

props.name: metadata
props.docs: The metadata displayed next to the `heading`.

events.docs: Emitted when the table density select value is changed.

slots.name: custom-actions
slots.docs: Render additional custom actions to the left of the density select.

slots.name: description
slots.docs: Render an alternative description in the description section.

slots.name: heading
slots.docs: The heading to render on the data table title bar.

slots.name: primary-action
slots.docs: Render an interactive element that will perform a primary action. Renders to the right of the density select.

props.name: dateFormat
props.docs: The format in which the date will be displayed.

props.name: disableDays
props.docs: The days of the week to disable.

props.name: disableDaysMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableDays` is set and a disabled date is entered.
props.default: "The date you have selected is on a day of the week that is not allowed. Please select another date."

props.name: disableFuture
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the future are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the future is entered.

props.name: disableFutureMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableFuture` is true and a date in the future is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the future are not allowed. Please select a date in the past."

props.name: disablePast
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the past are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the past is entered.

props.name: disablePastMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disablePast` is true and a date in the past is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the past are not allowed. Please select a date in the future."

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the disabled state will be set.

props.name: emitDatePartChange
props.docs: If `true`, every individual input field completed will emit an icChange event.

props.name: helperText
props.docs: The helper text that will be displayed for additional field guidance. This will default to the text "Use format" along with the `dateFormat` value.

props.name: hideHelperText
props.docs: If `true`, the helper text will be visually hidden, but still read out by screenreaders.

props.name: hideLabel
props.docs: If `true`, the label will be visually hidden, but will still be read out by screen readers.

props.name: inputId
props.docs: The ID for the input.

props.name: invalidDateMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when an invalid date is entered.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label for the date input.

props.name: max
props.docs:
The latest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disableFuture` is set to `true`.

props.name: min
props.docs:
The earliest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disablePast` is set to `true`.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the input will require a value.

props.name: showClearButton
props.docs: If `true`, a button which clears the date input when clicked will be displayed.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the date input to be displayed.

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the date picker to the dark or light theme colors. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

props.name: validationStatus
props.docs: The validation status - e.g. 'error' | 'warning' | 'success'. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: validationText
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the date input. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.

methods.name: getDate
methods.docs: Returns the value as a Date object

docsTags.name: returns
docsTags.text: Date

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.

events.detail: { value: Date | null; dateObject: { day: string | null; month: string | null; year: string | null; }; }

complexType.resolved: { value: Date | null; dateObject: { day: string | null; month: string | null; year: string | null; }; }

events.docs: Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the input gains focus.

props.name: dateFormat
props.docs: The format in which the date will be displayed.

props.name: disableDays
props.docs: The days of the week to disable.

props.name: disableDaysMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableDays` is `true` and a disabled date is entered.
props.default: "The date you have selected is on a day of the week that is not allowed. Please select another date."

props.name: disableFuture
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the future are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the future is entered.

props.name: disableFutureMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableFuture` is `true` and a date in the future is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the future are not allowed. Please select a date in the past."

props.name: disablePast
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the past are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the past is entered.

props.name: disablePastMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disablePast` is `true` and a date in the past is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the past are not allowed. Please select a date in the future."

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the disabled state will be set.

props.name: emitDatePartChange
props.docs: If `true`, every individual input field completed will emit an icChange event.

props.name: helperText
props.docs: The helper text that will be displayed for additional field guidance. This will default to the text "Use format" along with the `dateFormat` value.

props.name: hideHelperText
props.docs: If `true`, the helper text will be visually hidden, but still read out by screenreaders.

props.name: hideLabel
props.docs: If `true`, the label will be visually hidden, but the required label will still be read out by screen readers.

props.name: inputId
props.docs: The ID for the input field. The default will be an automatically generated value.

props.name: invalidDateMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when an invalid date is entered.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label for the date input.

props.name: max
props.docs:
The latest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disableFuture` is set to `true`.

props.name: min
props.docs:
The earliest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disablePast` is set to `true`.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: openAtDate
props.docs:
The date visible when the calendar opens. Used if no date is currently selected.
The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the input will require a value.

props.name: showDaysOutsideMonth
props.docs: If `true`, days outside the current month will be visible in the date picker.

props.name: showPickerClearButton
props.docs: If `true`, the `Clear` button on the date picker will be visible.

props.name: showPickerTodayButton
props.docs: If `true`, the `Go to today` button on the date picker will be visible.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the date picker to be displayed.

props.name: startOfWeek
props.type: IcWeekDays.Friday | IcWeekDays.Monday | IcWeekDays.Saturday | IcWeekDays.Sunday | IcWeekDays.Thursday | IcWeekDays.Tuesday | IcWeekDays.Wednesday

complexType.resolved: IcWeekDays.Friday | IcWeekDays.Monday | IcWeekDays.Saturday | IcWeekDays.Sunday | IcWeekDays.Thursday | IcWeekDays.Tuesday | IcWeekDays.Wednesday

props.docs:
The first day of the week. `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the date picker to the dark or light theme colors. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

props.name: validationStatus
props.docs: The validation status - e.g. 'error' | 'warning' | 'success'. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: validationText
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the date picker. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.

events.docs: Emitted when the value has changed.

props.name: alignment
props.docs: Sets the alignment of the items in the pagination bar.

props.name: currentPage
props.docs: The current page number to be displayed on the pagination bar.

props.name: hideAllFromItemsPerPage
props.docs: If `true`, the 'All' option will be hidden from the 'items per page' select input.

props.name: hideRangeLabel
props.docs: If `true`, the number of total items and current item range or number of total pages and current page will be hidden.

props.name: itemLabel
props.docs: The text which will be used in place of 'Item' on the pagination bar.

props.name: itemsPerPageOptions
props.docs: The options which will be displayed for 'items per page' select input.

props.name: monochrome
props.docs: If `true`, the pagination bar will display as black in the light theme, and white in dark theme.

props.name: pageLabel
props.docs: The text which will be used in place of 'Page' on the pagination bar.

props.name: rangeLabelType
props.docs: Whether total number of items and current item range or total number of pages and current page is displayed.

props.name: selectedItemsPerPage
props.docs: The items per page option to be selected.

props.name: setToFirstPageOnPaginationChange
props.docs: If `true`, the pagination bar is set to the first page when the 'items per page' changes

props.name: showGoToPageControl
props.docs: If `true`, the 'go to page' control should be displayed.

props.name: showItemsPerPageControl
props.docs: If `true`, the select input to control 'items per page' should be displayed.

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the theme color to the dark or light theme color. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

props.name: totalItems
props.docs: Total number of items to be displayed across all pages.

props.name: type
props.docs: Whether the displayed pagination is simple or complex.

events.docs: Emitted when the items per page option is changed.

Emitted when a page is navigated to via the 'go to' input.
The `detail` property contains `value` (i.e. the page number) and a `fromItemsPerPage` flag to indicate if the event was triggered by the `icItemsPerPageChange` event also occurring.

docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.name: slot

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the tree item appears in the disabled state.

props.name: expanded
props.docs: If `true`, the tree item appears in the expanded state.

props.name: href
props.docs: The URL that the tree item link points to. If set, the tree item will render as an "a" tag, otherwise it will render as a div.

props.name: hreflang
props.docs: The human language of the linked URL.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label of the tree item.

props.name: referrerpolicy
props.docs: How much of the referrer to send when following the link.

props.name: rel
props.docs: The relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types.

props.name: selected
props.docs: If `true`, the tree item appears in the selected state.

props.name: target
props.docs: The place to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context (a tab, window, or iframe).

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the theme color to the dark or light theme color. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

props.name: truncateTreeItem
props.docs: If `true`, the tree item label will be truncated instead of text wrapping.

events.docs: Emitted when tree item is selected.

slots.name: icon
slots.docs: Content is placed to the left of the label.

slots.name: label
slots.docs: Content is set as the tree item label.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: heading - Content is set as the tree view heading.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: icon - Content is placed to the left of the heading.

props.name: focusInset
props.docs: If `true`, tree items will have inset focus.

props.name: heading
props.docs: The heading of the tree view.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the tree view.

props.name: theme
props.docs: Sets the theme color to the dark or light theme color. "inherit" will set the color based on the system settings or ic-theme component.

props.name: treeItemData
props.docs: The content within the tree view tree items. This will take precedence over slotted content.

props.name: truncateHeading
props.docs:
If `true`, the tree view heading will be truncated instead of text wrapping.
When used on small devices, this prop will be overridden and headings will be set to text-wrap.

props.name: truncateTreeItems
props.docs:
If `true`, tree items will be truncated, unless they are individually overridden.
When used on small devices, this prop will be overridden and tree-items will be set to text-wrap.

slots.name: heading
slots.docs: Content is set as the tree view heading.

slots.name: icon
slots.docs: Content is placed to the left of the heading.

src/utils/types.ts::IcWeekDays.declaration:
export enum IcWeekDays {
  Sunday = 0,
  Monday = 1,
  Tuesday = 2,
  Wednesday = 3,
  Thursday = 4,
  Friday = 5,
  Saturday = 6,
}
